articles.author: The Star Online
articles.title: Asia's air travel may take three years to recover from pandemic - The Star Online
articles.description: ASIAN air travel may take another three years to recover fully from the devastation wrought by the pandemic, lagging behind rebounds in other regions and offering a stern headwind for refiners making jet fuel.
articles.content: ASIAN air travel may take another three years to recover fully from the devastation wrought by the pandemic, lagging behind rebounds in other regions and offering a stern headwind for refiners making… [+3624 chars]

articles.title: Indonesia posts record daily COVID-19 infections as it becomes new 'epicentre of Asia' - SBS News
articles.description: Indonesia reported more than 54,000 new coronavirus cases for the first time Wednesday, surpassing recent daily infections in India, whose disastrous outbreak is declining, and becoming Asia’s new virus hotspot.
articles.content: Virus-wracked Indonesia posted record daily infections topping 54,000 on Wednesday as the highly infectious Delta variant rips across the archipelago, catapulting it ahead of India as Asia's COVID-19… [+2882 chars]

articles.author: Chris Barrett
articles.title: Crushed by COVID, Malaysia now has one of the world’s fastest vaccination rates - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: As vaccine hesitancy gave way to desperation, the south-east Asian nation renegotiated its deal with Pfizer and now it delivers more than 400,000 shots a day.
articles.content: After a slow start, a quarter of the population has now received at least one dose and Malaysias target of having 40 per cent of adults fully vaccinated by the end of August and 60 per cent by the en… [+3965 chars]

articles.title: Cyberattacks with links to Chinese-speaking group target PH gov't entities – Kaspersky - Rappler
articles.description: LuminousMoth is said to have links with HoneyMyte, a Chinese-speaking group gathering geopolitical and economic intelligence in Asia and Africa
